--- title: core keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "contains all the functions of fast_neptune" ---

Code cells¶

Here we define regex, inspired by the ones used in nbdev.

is_code[source]

is_code(cell:dict, default='main.py')

Checks if cell is to be exported and returns the name of the module to export it if provided.

Parses the cell of a Jupyter Notebook, checks if it has the #code tag, and returns the name of the module it is associated with, otherwise returns None.

Args: cell: dict of the JSON of the cell default: name of the default module where all #code will be added Returns: The string of the name of the cell it is associated if #code is present, else None

get_codes[source]

get_codes(fn:str, default:str='main.py')

Returns a dictionary where each key contains the name of the module, and the value is the code in it.

Properties¶

OS information¶

get_metadata[source]

get_metadata()

Returns metadata about the current running environment.

get_metadata()

{'os': 'nt', 'system': 'Windows', 'release': '10', 'python_version': '3.7.5'}

Modules information¶

create_requirements[source]

create_requirements(fn)

Create requirements file

Properties cells¶

is_property[source]

is_property(cell)

Check if cell is to be exported and returns the name of the module to export it if provided

add_cell_to_properties[source]

add_cell_to_properties(cell:dict, properties:dict, globs:dict)

Adds all variables in the cell to the properties

files_in_properties[source]

files_in_properties(properties:dict)

Returns the list of files from properties

get_properties_from_cells[source]

get_properties_from_cells(fn:str, globs:dict, return_files:bool=True)

Gets the properties from all #property cells

Wrapper¶

fast_experiment[source]

fast_experiment(project:Project, nb_name:str, globs:dict, return_files:bool=True, default:str='main.py', **kwargs)

Creates a Neptune ML experiment, wrapped with meta data.

Args: project: Neptune Project nb_name: str name of the current notebook to be recorded globs: dict of the global variables. Simply set globs = globals() and then pass it. return_files: bool, True if we want to send files recorded in the parameters. default: str name of the default code kwargs: additional args passed to Neptune ML when the experiment is created

Returns: exp: Neptune ML experiment
